com.fizzikgames.fizlib.console

Interface ConsoleCommand

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClConnect, SvClose, SvOpen, SvTitle

    public interface ConsoleCommand
    A console command has all of the information needed to parse and process a user command for the console.
    Version:
    1.00
    Author:
    Maxim Tiourin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String executeCommand(java.lang.String[] args)
      Attempts to execute the command with the supplied args.
      java.lang.String getCommandDescription()
      Returns a description of the command.
      java.lang.String getCommandName()
      Returns the string name reference for the command.
      java.lang.String getCommandUseInfo()
      Returns information about how to use the command.
      int getMaximumArguments()
      Returns the maximum amount of arguments this command takes.
      int getMinimumArguments()
      Returns the minimum amount of arguments this command takes.

    • Method Detail

      • getCommandName

        java.lang.String getCommandName()
        Returns the string name reference for the command.
        Example: commandName
        Returns:
        String the name of the command, used for calling itself.

      • getCommandDescription

        java.lang.String getCommandDescription()
        Returns a description of the command.
        Example: Does A, B, and C.
        Returns:
        String description of the command.

      • getCommandUseInfo

        java.lang.String getCommandUseInfo()
        Returns information about how to use the command.
        Example: commandName \ [\ ... \]
        Returns:
        String information about how to use the command.

      • getMaximumArguments

        int getMaximumArguments()
        Returns the maximum amount of arguments this command takes.
        Returns:
        int maximum amount of arguments to pass to this command

      • getMinimumArguments

        int getMinimumArguments()
        Returns the minimum amount of arguments this command takes.
        Returns:
        int minimum amount of arguments to pass to this command

      • executeCommand

        java.lang.String executeCommand(java.lang.String[] args)
        Attempts to execute the command with the supplied args. The resulting log string is returned.
        Parameters:
        args - The list of arguments
        Returns:
        String the resulting log string of the execution.
